fr.xephi.authme.security.crypts

Interface EncryptionMethod

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Argon2, BCrypt, BCrypt2y, BCryptBasedHash, CmwCrypt, CrazyCrypt1, DoubleMd5, HexSaltedMethod, Ipb3, Ipb4, Joomla, Md5, Md5vB, MyBB, Pbkdf2, Pbkdf2Django, PhpBB, PhpFusion, RoyalAuth, Salted2Md5, SaltedSha512, SeparateSaltMethod, Sha1, Sha256, Sha512, Smf, TwoFactor, UnsaltedMethod, UsernameSaltMethod, Wbb3, Wbb4, Whirlpool, Wordpress, XAuth, XfBCrypt

    public interface EncryptionMethod
    Public interface for custom password encryption methods.

    Instantiation of these methods is done via automatic dependency injection.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean comparePassword(String password, HashedPassword hashedPassword, String name)
      Check whether the given hash matches the clear-text password.
      HashedPassword computeHash(String password, String name)
      Hash the given password for the given player name.
      String computeHash(String password, String salt, String name)
      Hash the given password with the given salt for the given player.
      String generateSalt()
      Generate a new salt to hash a password with.
      boolean hasSeparateSalt()
      Return whether the encryption method requires the salt to be stored separately and passed again to comparePassword(String, HashedPassword, String).

    • Method Detail

      • computeHash

        HashedPassword computeHash(String password,
                           String name)
        Hash the given password for the given player name.
        Parameters:
        password - The password to hash
        name - The name of the player (sometimes required to generate a salt with)
        Returns:
        The hash result for the password.
        See Also:
        HashedPassword

      • computeHash

        String computeHash(String password,
                   String salt,
                   String name)
        Hash the given password with the given salt for the given player.
        Parameters:
        password - The password to hash
        salt - The salt to add to the hash
        name - The player's name (sometimes required to generate a salt with)
        Returns:
        The hashed password
        See Also:
        hasSeparateSalt()

      • comparePassword

        boolean comparePassword(String password,
                        HashedPassword hashedPassword,
                        String name)
        Check whether the given hash matches the clear-text password.
        Parameters:
        password - The clear-text password to verify
        hashedPassword - The hash to check the password against
        name - The player name to do the check for (sometimes required for generating the salt)
        Returns:
        True if the password matches, false otherwise

      • generateSalt

        String generateSalt()
        Generate a new salt to hash a password with.
        Returns:
        The generated salt, null if the method does not use a random text-based salt

      • hasSeparateSalt

        boolean hasSeparateSalt()
        Return whether the encryption method requires the salt to be stored separately and passed again to comparePassword(String, HashedPassword, String). Note that an encryption method returning false does not imply that it uses no salt; it may be embedded into the hash or it may use the username as salt.
        Returns:
        True if the salt has to be stored and retrieved separately, false otherwise
